title: There are Trump supporters and some Republicans who are vehemently against wearing masks despite CDC recommendations. Why? - Quora
tags: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Well, there is a reason to question the value of the recommendation. An awful lot of people still think wearing a mask helps prevent THEM from getting the disease. That is blatantly false Wearing a mask is meant to prevent someone with the disease (knowingly or not) from spreading it. It doesn’t help someone without the disease for them to wear it, it helps if people with the disease wear it. And there’s been a lot of excess by local governments. There’s been at least one case of someone being put in jail for not wearing a mask…a place where they’re more likely to be exposed. I think it’s nothing but a placebo. I don’t believe the science of the past few decades has changed. It’s a placebo, meant to make people think they’re doing something when they’re not. I don’t really care. I have a face covering I wear if I go somewhere only because the dumb fucks in local government insist on it. I’m not ready to make a scene at some retail place because it isn’t their rule, it’s the government being absurd. I do take it off sometimes though. I have gone to a shooting range. I take off the mask when I’m in my lane. Not doing so sends heated air (exhaling) into my protective eyewear and that fogs up the glasses which in turn interferes with the ability to see the target. But it’s back on when I leave the lane and comes off when I get near my car.

Let’s take this back a step. How many times and how many people go to their doctor or dentist, for a check up and hear this: You’ve gained some weight since our last visit, I’d like to see you down 10 lbls for our follow up visit in 2 months about your high blood pressure. You know, it looks like I can’t save that tooth, so we are looking at another root canal. You know less coffee would be better for your tooth enamel. And you are brushing three times a day aren’t you? What do these statements sound like? They sound like a parent nagging you to behave better, and you are paying the person who is doing this to act like and parent,nag you and make you feel bad or guilty about how you are treating your body. My sense is that very few people are going to tell a medical provider who they have to (a) pay; (b) see on a regular basis and (c) may need in an emergency to go to hell. Those same individuals are on the other hand, happy to say go to hell to a public health bureaucrat they have never seen before, they don’t really know or care about and who they feel no obligation to pay attention to. Hence the mask problem.
